title: 107_hr2787
content:
SECTION 1. REFERENCE. This Act amends sections of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990. SEC. 2. FINDINGS AND PURPOSE. Congress makes findings related to mothers in the workforce, children with disabilities, and early intervention services under the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. The General Accounting Office reports on the supply of infant care and care for special needs children. The Individuals with Disabilities Education Act mandates special education preschool services to be provided in inclusive environments with nondisabled peers. The General Accounting Office highlights limited availability of infant care, care for special needs children, and care during nonstandard hours, especially in low-income communities. Children with disabilities face barriers in accessing child care programs due to misconceptions, stereotypes, and lack of staff training. The purpose of the Act is to enhance the availability of quality child care for children with disabilities. SEC. 3. APPLICATION AND PLAN. Amends Section 658E(c) to include families with children with disabilities. SEC. 4. ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE THE QUALITY OF CHILD CARE. Section 658G (42 U.S.C. 9858e) is amended to include activities for children with disabilities, requiring states to use at least 5 percent of funds for quality child care for children with disabilities. The amendment to Section 658G requires states to allocate a minimum of 5 percent of funds for activities aimed at increasing quality child care for children with disabilities, including training and technical assistance for child care providers, state licensing agencies, and parents on implementing the Americans with Disabilities Act of 1990. State licensing agencies provide guidance to child care providers and parents on collaborating to implement the Americans with Disabilities Act and the Individuals with Disabilities Education Act. They offer technical assistance to help child care providers include children with disabilities in child care settings and provide training on assistive technology for children with special needs. Training for child care directors and staff on assistive technology and leadership skills to operate inclusive child care programs. Assistance provided to State and local child care resource agencies. Assistance provided to child care resource agencies on compliance with disability laws and education acts. Grants for recruitment and retention of qualified staff, including scholarships for child care staff working with children with disabilities. Grants for recruitment and retention of qualified child care staff, including scholarships for staff to obtain degrees or training in child development, salary increases for staff with higher education, and grants to retain qualified providers in the field. Grants and loans are provided for child care programs to increase availability of inclusive child care, infant care, and care during evenings and weekends. SEC. 5. REPORTS.

Section 658K(a)(1)(B)(iii) (42 U.S.C. 9858i(a)(1)(B)(iii)) is amended to include "disability status" in addition to age.

SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. SEC. 6. DEFINITIONS. Amends Section 658P to define "child with a disability" and "inclusive child care program".
